div.l: Loo swilk a couplyng is in mangẻres The abbreviation is not clear, but looks like other such marks in the ms. thaym alle
A wylde fyre on thayre bodyes falle
Who herked eủere swilk a ferly þyng
Ȝe they sal haue the floure of ille endyng
This lange nyght þer tides me na reste
But ȝit na force al sal be for þe beste
For Iohn seyde he as eủere mote I thryue
If þᵗat I may ȝon wenche wol I swyue
Som esement has lawe shapen vs
For Iohn þer is a lawe þᵗat saith thus
That ȝif a man in oo point be a greued
That in another he sall be releued
¶ Oure corn is stolen soþly it is no nay
And we haue had an ille fitte to day
And syn I shall haue / nan amendement
Agayn my losse / I wil haue esement
By goddes saule it sal nan oþer be
This Iohn answerde Alayn avise the
The meller is a ꝑperilous man he seide
And ȝif þat he out of his sleep abreyde
He myghte done vs boþe a vylenye
Aleyne answerde I counte hym not a flye
And vp he rist and by þe wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vprighte and faste slepte
Til he so nygh was or she myghte aspie
That it hadde been to late for to crie
And shortly for to seyn þei were at on
Now play Aleyn for I wol speke of Iohn
¶ This Iohn lyth stille a fourlong weye or two
And to hym self he maketh routhe and wo
Allas qduod he þis is a wikked iape
Now may I say that I is but an ape
Ȝit has my felawe somwhat for his harm
He has þe meller doughter in his arm
He auntred hym and hath his nedes sped
And I lygge as a draf sak̄ in my bed
And whan this Iape is tolde anoþer day
I shal be holde a daffe a cokenay
I wol arise and auntre it by my faith
